school.name: Twents Carmel College, locatie De Thij

projects.title: Europe in crisis: a call for dialogue, what can youth workers contribute?
projects.description:
The project aimed to equip youth workers with competences to promote intercultural and
interreligious dialogue in local and international activities, particularly focused on the European
Refugee Crisis. It took place in Estonia and the budget was 19.000 euro.

projects.title: Challenge 2 Change: Gender Perspectives in Europe
projects.description: This international, 7 days training course took place in Armenia and it gathered 24 youth workers in order to learn about gender equality concepts, exchange experiences and to promote gender equality in youth work. The budget was 27.000 euro.

projects.title: From new challenges to innovative contributions: using online tools to promote exchange and understanding
projects.description: The main aim of this international, 7 days training course was to empower youth workers with essential competences to promote exchange and understanding, using online tools. The budget was 25.000 euro.

projects.title: Human Library Groningen 2016
projects.description: On 25 June I co-organized the third official Human Library in Groningen. I was mainly responsible for coordination, finances and PR. The event was a success, with all books (20) continuously 'on loan' during the day. The Human Library is originally a Danish initiative and the idea is that visitors, common people, get the chance to read a Human Book. Meaning: having a short conversation with a person. But not just a person. The Human Book is somebody who is deadling with stereotypes on a daily basis. Somebody who people have prejudices against. For example an ex-convict, a transgender or a refugee. Visitors of the Human Library get the chance to check their prejudices with one of these persons, or just have a nice conversation with somebody you would normally never speak to.

projects.title: Don’t judge a book by its cover: Empowering youngsters to organize a Human Library
projects.description: This international training provided 24 youth workers with skills and knowledge and attitudes to empower youngsters organize a Human Library in their local reality. The budget was 24.000 euro.

projects.title: Conflict Management Tools for Youth Workers
projects.description: The aim of this international 7-day training was to develop competences (skills, knowledge and attitudes) of 24 youth workers in the field of Conflict Management. The budget was 24.000 euro.

projects.title: Empowering youngsters to improve their influence on decision making processes
projects.description: This international training developed competences of 24 youth workers to empower youngsters with skills, knowledge and attitudes to improve their influence on decision making processes. The budget was 21.000 euro.

projects.title: Human Library Groningen 2015
projects.description: On 22 and 23 May 2015 I co-organized the second official Human Library in Groningen. I was mainly responsible for fundraising (result: 1050 euro, from four different NGO funds). The Human Library is originally a Danish initiative and the idea is that visitors, common people, get the chance to read a Human Book. Meaning: having a short conversation with a person. But not just a person. The Human Book is somebody who is deadling with stereotypes on a daily basis. Somebody who people have prejudices against. For example an ex-convict, a transgender or a refugee. Visitors of the Human Library get the chance to check their prejudices with one of these persons, or just have a nice conversation with somebody you would normally never speak to. The two-day event was a success, with 20 Books on both days, almost continuously being 'on loan'.

projects.title: Youth work and European Citizenship: raising understanding and developing tools
projects.description: I organize an international training for youth workers to raise understanding of the concepts of ‘Europe’ and ‘citizenship’ and to develop tools for youth workers on these themes. The training will take place in Ommen, the Netherlands, It lasts one week and the program was awarded a 25.000 EUR grant by the Erasmus Plus Program of the European Commission. The 24 participants come from Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Cyprus, Georgia, Kosovo, the Netherlands, Poland, the United Kingdom, Ukraine and Turkey.

projects.title: Stop Gender Based Violence Now!
projects.description: I worked as a facilitator of a 7-day training in Kaunas, Lithuania, on combating Gender Based Violence (GBV). It was organized by JMB Lithuania, in cooperation with Youth for Exchange and Understanding. 24 participants from different countries were present, coming from countries in Europe, the Caucasus and the Middle East. I delivered multiple workshops, based on non-formal education.

projects.title: Joining Hands: Getting Started, Training on Social Entrepreneurship
projects.description: I worked as a facilitator of a 7-day training in Amarante, Portugal, on the concept of social entrepreneurship and the need for it in present-day Europe. It was organized by Youth for Exchange and Understanding International and 20 participants from different countries attended the course. I delivered multiple workshops, based on non-formal education. I shot and edited a small Youtube movie on the project: http://youtu.be/1wTdBou-vIA.

projects.title: Job Shadowing Project JUB - Kartlosi
projects.description: I spent 3,5 week in Georgia, working together with colleagues from our Georgian partner organization Bridge Of Friendship Kartlosi. The aim was to exchange best practises and to develop new projects together. The Job Shadowing project was awarded with a 2000 EUR grant by the Erasmus Plus programme of the European Commission.

contributors.headline: Program Development Specialist, Social Therapist (Psychiatry), pursuing a degree in Psychology

projects.title: European Youth Event
projects.description: I worked as a facilitator at a 3-day project in Strasbourg, France, on finalizing and promoting a policy paper on social inclusion. It was organized by Youth for Exchange and Understanding International and 24 participants from different countries attended the project. I delivered multiple workshops, based on non-formal education.

projects.title: Human Library Groningen
projects.description:
On 17th of May 2014 I co-organized the first official Human Library in Groningen. Originally it is a Danish initiative and the idea is that visitors, common people, get the chance to read a Human Book. Meaning: having a short conversation with a person. But not just a person. The Human Book is somebody who is deadling with stereotypes on a daily basis. Somebody who people have prejudices against. For example an ex-convict, a transgender or a refugee. Visitors of the Human Library get the chance to check their prejudices with one of these persons, or just have a nice conversation with somebody you would normally never speak to. The day was a success, with 15 Books, almost continuously being 'on loan'. For a photo impression of the event, please click on the title. 

I was responsible for a big part of the general organization and I conducted preparation trainings for the Human Books and for the volunteers.

projects.title: Open Campus: Getting Online for Advocacy
projects.description: I worked as a facilitator of a 7-day training in Warsaw, Poland, on policy and advocacy regarding social exclusion. It was organized by Youth for Exchange and Understanding International and 20 participants from different countries attended the course. I delivered multiple workshops, based on non-formal education.

projects.title: Demo - Crises
projects.description: I worked as a facilitator of a 8-day training in Istanbul, Turkey, on the inclusion of minorities in democracies. It was organized by Democracy Action Group Turkey and 24 participants from different countries attended the course. I delivered multiple workshops, based on non-formal education.

projects.title: School of Social Entrepreneurship
projects.description: I delivered a 1 day workshop during a training in Leuven, Belgium, on intercultural learning and dealing with conflicts. The participants were youth leaders from Belgium and Palestine and it was organized by Aegee Leuven.

projects.title: Youth and their Preparation for the Labor Market, through engagement in CSO's
projects.description: I worked as a facilitator of a 7-day training in Bar, Montenegro, on promoting the active involvement of youth in NGO's and other measures to prepare youth as best as possible for the labor market. It was organized by ADP ZID and 24 participants from different countries attended the course. I delivered multiple workshops, based on non-formal education.

projects.title: Democracy: Majority Rules?
projects.description: I organized an international training for youth workers on the meaning of democracy for young people, mostly focusing on the post conflict Caucasus region. The training took place in Gori, Georgia, in cooperation with our Georgian partner Bridge of Friendship Kartlosi. It lasted one week and the program was awarded a 15.000 EUR grant by the Youth in Action Program of the European Commission. The 20 participants came from Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belgium, Georgia, the Netherlands, Lithuania, Ukraine and Turkey.

contributors.headline:
Adviseur Architectuurhistorie bij de RCE,     
                         Netwerker Stedelijk voor de Erfgoed Deal

projects.title: Youth Transforming Conflict: Training for Trainers on Peace Education
projects.description: I organized an international training for youth workers on conflict transformation, mostly focused on the Balkan and the Caucasus regions. It lasted one week and the program was awarded a 25.000 EUR grant by the Youth in Action Programme of the European Commission. The 24 participants came from 12 countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Cyprus, Georgia, Kosovo, Macedonia, the Netherlands, Serbia, Slovenia and Turkey.

contributors.headline: Projectleider traineeprogramma De Toekomst van Brabant
Deputy team lead natural gas @Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat

profile_positions.description:
JUB (meaning literally Youth for Exchange and Understanding) promotes peace, understanding and co-operation between people from different countries and cultures. To reach those goals, JUB organizes international trainings, mainly for youth workers. Focus areas are currently EU countries, the Balkan, the Caucasus and the Middle East. Further, JUB encourages active involvement in the society and promotes human rights. 

As chairman of JUB I coordinate the strategy, keep up a network of contacts, manage the board, write and supervise grant applications, motivate volunteers, work on visibility etc.
profile_positions.title: Chairman

profile_positions.description: After my internship I was asked to stay a bit longer, to work temporarily at the front desk of the party bureau. It was a busy period, because of the national elections of 12 September 2012. I received many phone calls on the elections and I welcomed guests. In many cases I could answer questions myself, in specific cases i referred them to the relevant office. I helped promoting D66 in several public events and with the preparation of party conferences.
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Agent

profile_positions.description:
The Mr. Hans van Mierlo Stichting is the scientific department of the Dutch political party D66. Its aim is to develop the social-liberal signature of the party. It functions as a bridge between science and politics, for example by organizing meetings and publishing a magazine called 'Idee'. 

My main responsibility was to organize the annual Van Mierlo Symposium, on the New Civil Society, with key-note speaker Alexander Rinnooy Kan. To introduce the Symposium and its theme, I directed a short movie (find it below). Other responsibilities were conducting interviews for Idee and organizing two international meetings, on behalf of the European Liberal Forum and the talent programme of D66.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: I was in Libya during the popular uprising against Gadaffi, which was definitely an interesting period. I learned a lot by working under pressure in such a challenging environment. Amongst other things, I contributed to news briefings, security reports and safety documents. Before the revolution I also wrote a funding proposal and I joined field visits. After the revolution I blogged for the University Paper about Libya.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

volunteer_experiences.description:
Ubbo Emmius is a history student union in Groningen. It has 800 members and it combines educational and leisure activities. 

I organized several educational activities in different committees, with mixed responsibilities. Twice I functioned as the promotion officer for congresses about Russia and Religion & Politics (both sold out with 100 and 150 visitors), as chairman I was responsible for organizing historical movie nights with an inroduction from a lecturer and in my first year as a student I wrote for the student union magazine.
